node.title: Leftovers Are Better Than the Feast
node.description: Make the best possible sandwich, or a big batch of turkey bone gumbo.

node.title: Five Science-Fiction Movies to Stream Now
node.description: This month’s picks include an amnesiac romance and acts of sentient killer robot rampage.

node.title: On Their Small Shoulders Rest Some Big Films
node.description: Five children winning acclaim for their roles in “Belfast,” “King Richard,” “C’mon C’mon” and “The Tender Bar” talk us through their starring turns.

node.title: Europe’s Theaters Go Back to the Future With Covid Restrictions
node.description: Strict controls on playhouses and music venues are returning as the continent deals with a new coronavirus wave.

node.title: Makayla Noble Update As Cheerleader Celebrates First Thanksgiving Since Being Paralyzed
node.description: "Thanksgiving may look different than we thought, but we still have a lot to be thankful for," the teenager's mother said.

node.title: Most African Countries to Miss Vaccine Targets as B.1.1.529 COVID Variant Emerges in Continent
node.description: The WHO predicted last month that about 10 percent of countries in Africa would meet global vaccination targets set earlier this year.

node.title: 'No Question' Flash Mob Robberies Will Spread Across the Country: Ex-Police Commissioner
node.description: Former Philadelphia Police Commissioner Charles Ramsey said police in California may struggle to "get a handle" on the smash-and-grab crime trend.

node.title: Viral Video of Robot Server at Denny's Sparks Debate: 'I Would Walk Out'
node.description: As labor shortages continue in the U.S., restaurants are turning to help in the form of robots, but not everyone is a fan.

node.title: Ethiopia's Prime Minister appears at battlefront of Tigray war vowing to 'bury the enemy'
node.description: Ahmed Abiy appears in a video aired by state media, purportedly showing the Nobel Peace Prize winner on the frontline of the country's yearlong war against Tigray forces.

node.title: Book excerpt: "A Tattoo On My Brain: A Neurologist's Personal Battle Against Alzheimer's Disease"
node.description: Dr. Daniel Gibbs writes about how, after spending his career caring for patients with Alzheimer's, he has now moved to studying the disease from the perspective of a patient himself.

node.title: ‘I Savor Everything’: A Soprano’s Star Turn at the Met Opera
node.description: Erin Morley, a fixture at the Met for over a decade, is now singing the title role in “Eurydice.”

node.title: Conservative Leader Says 'Female Replacements' in Media Lead to Crime in Controversial Speech
node.description: "Is there any wonder we are seeing so many young men committing crime?" asked Nick Fletcher in a speech that targeted "Doctor Who" and other media.

node.title: In Good Spirits
node.description: Carissa Schumacher channels the dead for her A-list celebrity clients.But most days, she’s in the forest.

node.title: Review: Getting a Moral Fix From ‘Approval Junkie’
node.description: The radio and television journalist Faith Salie stars in a one-woman show about the perils of striving for achievement and affirmation.

node.title: Back to full capacity and on the hunt for Legos in New Jersey.
node.description: A father of three got some Christmas shopping done and the Garden State Plaza expected a busy day.

node.title: What Anthony Fauci Has Said About Nu B.1.1.529 COVID Variant
node.description: As fear over the B.1.1.529 variant, which has been detected in southern Africa, increases, Fauci told CNN: "You need to protect the American public."

node.title: New B.1.1.529 COVID Variant Called 'Most Significant to Date' by Top U.K. Health Official
node.description: "This is a clear reminder to everyone that this pandemic is not over," UKHSA Chief Executive Dr. Jenny Harries said.

node.title: Pizzeria Worker Describes 'Disbelief' at Man Who Pulled Out AK-47 Due to 10-Minute Wait
node.description: Charles Doty Jr., 63, faces felony charges over the November 5 incident at Little Caesars in Knoxville, Tennessee.

node.title: FDA says experimental COVID-19 pill from Merck is effective
node.description: Federal health regulators said they will seek input from outside experts on risks of birth defects and other potential problems during pregnancy.

node.title: A Refugee’s Harrowing Story, Finally Told Through Animation
node.description: Jonas Poher Rasmussen’s childhood friend kept his flight from Afghanistan secret for 20 years. Now, Rasmussen has told his story through the award-winning film “Flee.”

node.title: Fresh Violence in Darfur Adds to Sudan’s Crises
node.description: At least 43 people have been killed in clashes in the area, the U.N. says, while the nation’s leaders are focused elsewhere, dealing with the fallout from a coup.

node.title: LAPD Steps up Patrols to Combat Rise in Flash Mob Robberies in California
node.description: A number of high-end stores have been targeted in recent days as groups of dozens stormed retail stores.

node.title: What We Know About Nu B.1.1.529 COVID Variant Ahead of WHO Assessment
node.description: World Health Organization experts will convene on Friday to assess a new COVID variant that has worried scientists because of its mutations.

node.title: Best Lululemon Black Friday Deals 2021: Save 50% On Leggings, Gymwear & More
node.description: This year's deals include discounts on Lululemon's famed Wunder Under leggings and a half-priced large convertible bag.

node.title: Mom Shares Daughter Quitting Target on Intercom Speaker, Calls It 'Epic'
node.description: The video of the young Target employee announcing her resignation to anyone who happened to be listening has been viewed over 400,000 times.

node.title: Watch NASA's Asteroid-Deflecting DART Spacecraft Speeding Through Space
node.description: The DART spacecraft will deliberately crash into a 530-foot-wide asteroid called Dimorphos in September 2022 at a speed of almost 15,000 miles per hour.

node.title: Black Friday Phone Deals 2021: Best Offers For iPhone, Samsung Galaxy, Earbuds & More
node.description: Black Friday is an ideal opportunity to grab smartphones on the cheap. Here are the best deals on offer for iPhones, Samsung Galaxy devices, and much more.

node.title: The Penthouse That Keeps Breaking Records in SoHo
node.description: The triplex on Broome Street sold for $49 million, which was the most expensive closing in New York City in November.

node.title: Their Holiday Parties Are Just Getting Restarted
node.description: A pair of caterers gear up for year-end celebrations at companies. “I think they really want to encourage people to think that returning to the office is a celebration of sorts.”

node.title: Slain Woman Had Begged Apartment Complex to Change Locks, Lawsuit Claims
node.description: A New Jersey mother had been granted a temporary restraining order against her husband before he killed her and their two children, according to a suit filed by the woman’s family.
